> When snake moves:
> 
> - Head moves to new cell
> 
> - Each body segment moves to the position of the previous segment
> 
> - If no food eaten, the last position (tail) is vacated
> 
> - If food eaten, the tail does not vacate; it stays, and the snake grows, so the new tail is the old tail position.
>

> After move to new head position:
>

> 
> - New segment 1: old segment 0 position
> 
> - New segment 2: old segment 1 position
> 
> - ...
> 
> - New segment k: old segment k-1 position
> 
> If no food eaten, the old segment k (tail) is removed, so length same.
> 
> If food eaten, old segment k is not removed, so new segment k is at old segment k-1 position, and new segment k+1 is at old segment k position (tail).

> General: food with life span L at turn t is available from turn t to turn t + L - 1, and disappears at turn t + L.
